person.persName: Erasmus Boyle Owsley (Jefferson County, Kentucky, representative, merchant, and pork packer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, representative, merchant, and pork packer. Garrard County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Owsley and Elizabeth Mary Gill Owsley. Married to Caroline E. Talbott Owsley in 1831. Father of S.C. Owsley and P. T. Owsley. Married to Catherine Elizabeth Bodley Owsley on May 24, 1842. Father of E.S. Owsley, Amelia Owsley, Annabel Owsley, and William Owsley. Studied law at Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1830. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Mercer County from 1841 to 1842. Merchant in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860. Pork packer in Louisville in 1861. Partners with J. Boyle Gill and Clifton Rhodes in Owsley & Company in Louisville in 1861. Pork packer in Louisville in 1865. Partner with Thomas P. White in Owsley & Company in Louisville in 1865.
